text: Kurakhove (, ) is a city in Marinka Raion of Donetsk Oblast (province) of Ukraine. Population: ; 21,479 (2001). At Kurakhove, there is Kurakhove Power Station. In Kurakhove the 11 May 2014 Donetsk Oblast independence referendum was conducted; but the city did not became part of the territory controlled by the Donetsk People's Republic (who held the referendum).https://www.wsj.com/articles/in-ukraines-east-low-voter-turnout- in-election-signals-kievs-challenges-1414358482 Since then the city is 10 miles west of the frontlines of the War in Donbass.https://www.wsj.com/articles/in-ukraines-east-low-voter-turnout-in- election-signals-kievs- challenges-1414358482http://www.kyivpost.com/content/kyiv-post-plus/kurakhove- a-ukrainian-controlled-city-10-kilometers-from-the-war-front-is-on-edge-with- residents-divided-392382.html ==Gallery== File:Kurahovsky city council Ukraine.jpg|City council File:Kurakhove 01.jpg|Church in Kurakhove File:Sport centre "Olympic" in Kurahovo.jpg|Sports centre File:The house along the street Lermontov.jpg|Lermontov Street in Kurakhove File:Вид с Красноармейского моста на элеватор и ТЭС.jpg|Kurakhove Reservoir ==References== Category:Cities in Donetsk Oblast Category:Cities of district significance in Ukraine Category:Populated places established in the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic
title: Kurakhove
